intro: Sorbus aria f. incisa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf whitebeam, is a botanical variant of the common whitebeam. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves that are typically serrated along the edges. This shrub or small tree is native to parts of Europe and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. The plant produces small, white flowers in spring, followed by orange-red berries in the fall. Its foliage and fruit make it an important component of local ecosystems, supporting various wildlife species.
